speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: You have not given him his mother’s

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: letter?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: I have delivered it an hour since. There

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: is something in ’t that stings his nature, for on the

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: reading it he changed almost into another man.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: He has much worthy blame laid upon him

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: for shaking off so good a wife and so sweet a lady.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Especially he hath incurred the everlasting

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: displeasure of the King, who had even tuned

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: his bounty to sing happiness to him. I will tell you

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: a thing, but you shall let it dwell darkly with you.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: When you have spoken it, ’tis dead, and I

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: am the grave of it.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: He hath perverted a young gentlewoman

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: here in Florence of a most chaste renown,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: and this night he fleshes his will in the spoil of her

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: honor. He hath given her his monumental ring and

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: thinks himself made in the unchaste composition.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Now God delay our rebellion! As we are

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: ourselves, what things are we!

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Merely our own traitors. And, as in the

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: common course of all treasons we still see them

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: reveal themselves till they attain to their abhorred

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: ends, so he that in this action contrives against his

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: own nobility, in his proper stream o’erflows

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: himself.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Is it not meant damnable in us to be trumpeters

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: of our unlawful intents? We shall not, then,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: have his company tonight?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Not till after midnight, for he is dieted to

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: his hour.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: That approaches apace. I would gladly

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: have him see his company anatomized, that he

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: might take a measure of his own judgments

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: wherein so curiously he had set this counterfeit.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: We will not meddle with him till he

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: come, for his presence must be the whip of the

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: other.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: In the meantime, what hear you of these

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: wars?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: I hear there is an overture of peace.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Nay, I assure you, a peace concluded.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: What will Count Rossillion do then?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Will he travel higher or return again into France?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: I perceive by this demand you are not altogether

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: of his counsel.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Let it be forbid, sir! So should I be a

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: great deal of his act.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Sir, his wife some two months since fled

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: from his house. Her pretense is a pilgrimage to

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Saint Jaques le Grand, which holy undertaking

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: with most austere sanctimony she accomplished.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: And, there residing, the tenderness of her nature

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: became as a prey to her grief; in fine, made a groan

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: of her last breath, and now she sings in heaven.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: How is this justified?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: The stronger part of it by her own letters,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: which makes her story true even to the point of her

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: death. Her death itself, which could not be her

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: office to say is come, was faithfully confirmed by

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: the rector of the place.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Hath the Count all this intelligence?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Ay, and the particular confirmations, point

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: from point, to the full arming of the verity.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: I am heartily sorry that he’ll be glad of

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: this.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: How mightily sometimes we make us

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: comforts of our losses.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: And how mightily some other times we

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: drown our gain in tears. The great dignity that his

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: valor hath here acquired for him shall at home be

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: encountered with a shame as ample.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: The web of our life is of a mingled yarn,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: good and ill together. Our virtues would be proud

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: if our faults whipped them not, and our crimes

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: would despair if they were not cherished by our

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: virtues.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: How now? Where’s your master?

speaker: SERVANT
text: He met the Duke in the street, sir, of whom

speaker: SERVANT
text: he hath taken a solemn leave. His Lordship will

speaker: SERVANT
text: next morning for France. The Duke hath offered

speaker: SERVANT
text: him letters of commendations to the King.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: They shall be no more than needful

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: there, if they were more than they can commend.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: They cannot be too sweet for the King’s tartness.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Here’s his Lordship now.—How now, my lord? Is ’t

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: not after midnight?

speaker: BERTRAM
text: I have tonight dispatched sixteen businesses,

speaker: BERTRAM
text: a month’s length apiece. By an abstract of

speaker: BERTRAM
text: success: I have congeed with the Duke, done my

speaker: BERTRAM
text: adieu with his nearest, buried a wife, mourned for

speaker: BERTRAM
text: her, writ to my lady mother I am returning, entertained

speaker: BERTRAM
text: my convoy, and between these main parcels

speaker: BERTRAM
text: of dispatch effected many nicer needs. The last

speaker: BERTRAM
text: was the greatest, but that I have not ended yet.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: If the business be of any difficulty, and

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: this morning your departure hence, it requires

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: haste of your Lordship.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: I mean the business is not ended as fearing

speaker: BERTRAM
text: to hear of it hereafter. But shall we have this dialogue

speaker: BERTRAM
text: between the Fool and the Soldier? Come,

speaker: BERTRAM
text: bring forth this counterfeit module; has deceived

speaker: BERTRAM
text: me like a double-meaning prophesier.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Bring him forth. Has sat i’ th’ stocks all

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: night, poor gallant knave.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: No matter. His heels have deserved it in

speaker: BERTRAM
text: usurping his spurs so long. How does he carry

speaker: BERTRAM
text: himself?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: I have told your Lordship already: the

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: stocks carry him. But to answer you as you would

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: be understood: he weeps like a wench that had

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: shed her milk. He hath confessed himself to Morgan,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: whom he supposes to be a friar, from the time

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: of his remembrance to this very instant disaster of

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: his setting i’ th’ stocks. And what think you he hath

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: confessed?

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Nothing of me, has he?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: His confession is taken, and it shall be

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: read to his face. If your Lordship be in ’t, as I

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: believe you are, you must have the patience to

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: hear it.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: A plague upon him! Muffled! He can say

speaker: BERTRAM
text: nothing of me.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Hush, hush. Hoodman

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: comes.—Portotartarossa.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: He calls for the tortures.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: What will you say without ’em?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I will confess what I know without constraint.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: If you pinch me like a pasty, I can say no

speaker: PAROLLES
text: more.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Bosko Chimurcho.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Boblibindo chicurmurco.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: You are a merciful general.—Our general

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: bids you answer to what I shall ask you out of a

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: note.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: And truly, as I hope to live.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text:
First
                ,
                 
                demand
                 
                of
                
                him
                 
                how
                 
                many
                 
                horse
                 
                the
                 
                Duke
                 
                is
                 
                strong
                .
              —What say

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: you to that?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Five or six thousand, but very weak and

speaker: PAROLLES
text: unserviceable. The troops are all scattered, and the

speaker: PAROLLES
text: commanders very poor rogues, upon my reputation

speaker: PAROLLES
text: and credit, and as I hope to live.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Shall I set down your answer so?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Do. I’ll take the Sacrament on ’t, how and

speaker: PAROLLES
text: which way you will.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: All’s one to him. What a past-saving

speaker: BERTRAM
text: slave is this!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: You’re deceived, my

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: lord. This is Monsieur Parolles, the gallant

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: militarist—that was his own phrase—that had the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: whole theoric of war in the knot of his scarf, and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: the practice in the chape of his dagger.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: I will never trust a man again for

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: keeping his sword clean, nor believe he can have

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: everything in him by wearing his apparel neatly.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Well, that’s set down.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: “Five or six thousand horse,” I said—I will

speaker: PAROLLES
text: say true—“or thereabouts” set down, for I’ll speak

speaker: PAROLLES
text: truth.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: He’s very near the truth in this.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: But I con him no thanks for ’t, in the

speaker: BERTRAM
text: nature he delivers it.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: “Poor rogues,” I pray you say.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Well, that’s set down.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I humbly thank you, sir. A truth’s a truth.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: The rogues are marvelous poor.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text:
Demand
                 
                of
                 
                him
                 
                of
                
                what
                 
                strength
                 
                they
                 
                are
                 
                o’
                 
                foot
                .
              —What say you to

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: that?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: By my troth, sir, if I were to live but this

speaker: PAROLLES
text: present hour, I will tell true. Let me see: Spurio a

speaker: PAROLLES
text: hundred and fifty, Sebastian so many, Corambus

speaker: PAROLLES
text: so many, Jaques so many; Guiltian, Cosmo,

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Lodowick and Gratii, two hundred fifty each; mine

speaker: PAROLLES
text: own company, Chitopher, Vaumond, Bentii, two

speaker: PAROLLES
text: hundred fifty each; so that the muster-file, rotten

speaker: PAROLLES
text: and sound, upon my life amounts not to fifteen

speaker: PAROLLES
text: thousand poll, half of the which dare not shake the

speaker: PAROLLES
text: snow from off their cassocks lest they shake themselves

speaker: PAROLLES
text: to pieces.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: What shall be done to him?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Nothing but let him have thanks.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text:
(
                Aside
                 
                to
                 
                First
                 
                Soldier
                .
              ) Demand of him my condition

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: and what credit I have with the Duke.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Well, that’s set down.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text:
You
                 
                shall
                 
                demand
                 
                of
                 
                him
                 
                whether
                
                one
                 
                Captain
                 
                Dumaine
                 
                be
                 
                i’
                 
                th’
                 
                camp
                ,
                 
                a
                 
                Frenchman
                ;
                
                what
                 
                his
                 
                reputation
                 
                is
                 
                with
                 
                the
                 
                Duke
                ,
                 
                what
                 
                his
                 
                valor
                ,
                
                honesty
                ,
                 
                and
                 
                expertness
                 
                in
                 
                wars
                ;
                 
                or
                 
                whether
                 
                he
                
                thinks
                 
                it
                 
                were
                 
                not
                 
                possible
                 
                with
                 
                well-weighing
                 
                sums
                
                of
                 
                gold
                 
                to
                 
                corrupt
                 
                him
                 
                to
                 
                a
                 
                revolt
                .
              —What say you to

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: this? What do you know of it?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I beseech you let me answer to the particular

speaker: PAROLLES
text: of the inter’gatories. Demand them singly.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Do you know this Captain Dumaine?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I know him. He was a botcher’s prentice in

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Paris, from whence he was whipped for getting the

speaker: PAROLLES
text: shrieve’s fool with child, a dumb innocent that

speaker: PAROLLES
text: could not say him nay.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Nay, by your leave, hold

speaker: BERTRAM
text: your hands, though I know his brains are forfeit to

speaker: BERTRAM
text: the next tile that falls.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Well, is this captain in the Duke of

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Florence’s camp?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Upon my knowledge he is, and lousy.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Nay, look not so upon

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: me. We shall hear of your Lordship anon.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: What is his reputation with the Duke?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: The Duke knows him for no other but a

speaker: PAROLLES
text: poor officer of mine, and writ to me this other day

speaker: PAROLLES
text: to turn him out o’ th’ band. I think I have his letter

speaker: PAROLLES
text: in my pocket.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Marry, we’ll search.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: In good sadness, I do not know. Either it is

speaker: PAROLLES
text: there, or it is upon a file with the Duke’s other letters

speaker: PAROLLES
text: in my tent.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Here ’tis; here’s a paper. Shall I read it to

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: you?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I do not know if it be it or no.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Our interpreter does it well.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Excellently.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
            
            
               
              reads
            
            
              
              Dian
              ,
               
              the
               
              Count’s
               
              a
               
              fool
               
              and
               
              full
              
              of
               
              gold
              —

speaker: PAROLLES
text: That is not the Duke’s letter, sir. That is an

speaker: PAROLLES
text: advertisement to a proper maid in Florence, one

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Diana, to take heed of the allurement of one Count

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Rossillion, a foolish idle boy, but for all that very

speaker: PAROLLES
text: ruttish. I pray you, sir, put it up again.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Nay, I’ll read it first, by your favor.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: My meaning in ’t, I protest, was very honest

speaker: PAROLLES
text: in the behalf of the maid, for I knew the young

speaker: PAROLLES
text: count to be a dangerous and lascivious boy, who is

speaker: PAROLLES
text: a whale to virginity and devours up all the fry it

speaker: PAROLLES
text: finds.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Damnable both-sides rogue!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
            
            
               
              reads
            
            
              
                
                  When
                   
                  he
                   
                  swears
                   
                  oaths
                  ,
                   
                  bid
                   
                  him
                   
                  drop
                   
                  gold
                  ,
                   
                  and

                  it
                  .
                
              
              
                
                  After
                   
                  he
                   
                  scores
                  ,
                   
                  he
                   
                  never
                   
                  pays
                   
                  the
                   
                  score
                  .
                
                
                  Half
                   
                  won
                   
                  is
                   
                  match
                   
                  well
                   
                  made
                  .
                   
                  Match
                  ,
                   
                  and
                   
                  well
                   
                  make
                   
                  it
                  .
                
                
                  He
                   
                  ne’er
                   
                  pays
                   
                  after-debts
                  .
                   
                  Take
                   
                  it
                   
                  before
                  .
                
              
              
                
                  And
                   
                  say
                   
                  a
                   
                  soldier
                  ,
                   
                  Dian
                  ,
                   
                  told
                   
                  thee
                   
                  this
                  :
                
                
                  Men
                   
                  are
                   
                  to
                   
                  mell
                   
                  with
                  ;
                   
                  boys

                  .
                
              
              
                
                  For
                   
                  count

                  :
                   
                  the

                  ,
                   
                  I

                Thine
                ,
                 
                as
                 
                he
                 
                vowed
                 
                to

                in

                ,
                
                Parolles
                .

speaker: BERTRAM
text: He shall be whipped through the

speaker: BERTRAM
text: army with this rhyme in ’s forehead.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: This is your devoted friend, sir,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: the manifold linguist and the armipotent soldier.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: I could endure anything before but a

speaker: BERTRAM
text: cat, and now he’s a cat to me.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: I perceive, sir, by our

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: general’s looks we shall be fain to hang you.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: My life, sir, in any case! Not that I am afraid

speaker: PAROLLES
text: to die, but that, my offenses being many, I would

speaker: PAROLLES
text: repent out the remainder of nature. Let me live,

speaker: PAROLLES
text: sir, in a dungeon, i’ th’ stocks, or anywhere, so I

speaker: PAROLLES
text: may live.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: We’ll see what may be done, so you confess

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: freely. Therefore once more to this Captain

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Dumaine: you have answered to his reputation

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: with the Duke, and to his valor. What is his

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: honesty?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: He will steal, sir, an egg out of a cloister. For

speaker: PAROLLES
text: rapes and ravishments, he parallels Nessus. He

speaker: PAROLLES
text: professes not keeping of oaths. In breaking ’em he

speaker: PAROLLES
text: is stronger than Hercules. He will lie, sir, with such

speaker: PAROLLES
text: volubility that you would think truth were a fool.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Drunkenness is his best virtue, for he will be

speaker: PAROLLES
text: swine-drunk, and in his sleep he does little harm,

speaker: PAROLLES
text: save to his bedclothes about him; but they know

speaker: PAROLLES
text: his conditions and lay him in straw. I have but

speaker: PAROLLES
text: little more to say, sir, of his honesty; he has everything

speaker: PAROLLES
text: that an honest man should not have; what an

speaker: PAROLLES
text: honest man should have, he has nothing.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: I begin to love him for this.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: For this description of thine honesty?

speaker: BERTRAM
text: A pox upon him! For me, he’s more and more

speaker: BERTRAM
text: a cat.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: What say you to his expertness in war?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Faith, sir, has led the drum before the English

speaker: PAROLLES
text: tragedians. To belie him I will not, and more

speaker: PAROLLES
text: of his soldiership I know not, except in that country

speaker: PAROLLES
text: he had the honor to be the officer at a place

speaker: PAROLLES
text: there called Mile End, to instruct for the doubling

speaker: PAROLLES
text: of files. I would do the man what honor I can, but

speaker: PAROLLES
text: of this I am not certain.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: He hath out-villained villainy so

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: far that the rarity redeems him.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: A pox on him! He’s a cat still.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: His qualities being at this poor price,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: I need not to ask you if gold will corrupt him to

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: revolt.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Sir, for a cardecu he will sell the fee-simple

speaker: PAROLLES
text: of his salvation, the inheritance of it, and cut th’

speaker: PAROLLES
text: entail from all remainders, and a perpetual succession

speaker: PAROLLES
text: for it perpetually.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: What’s his brother, the other Captain

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Dumaine?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Why does he ask him of me?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: What’s he?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: E’en a crow o’ th’ same nest: not altogether

speaker: PAROLLES
text: so great as the first in goodness, but greater a great

speaker: PAROLLES
text: deal in evil. He excels his brother for a coward, yet

speaker: PAROLLES
text: his brother is reputed one of the best that is. In a

speaker: PAROLLES
text: retreat he outruns any lackey. Marry, in coming on

speaker: PAROLLES
text: he has the cramp.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: If your life be saved, will you undertake

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: to betray the Florentine?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Ay, and the captain of his horse, Count

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Rossillion.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: I’ll whisper with the General and know

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: his pleasure.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I’ll no more drumming. A plague of

speaker: PAROLLES
text: all drums! Only to seem to deserve well, and to

speaker: PAROLLES
text: beguile the supposition of that lascivious young

speaker: PAROLLES
text: boy the Count, have I run into this danger. Yet who

speaker: PAROLLES
text: would have suspected an ambush where I was

speaker: PAROLLES
text: taken?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: There is no remedy, sir, but you must

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: die. The General says you that have so traitorously

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: discovered the secrets of your army and made

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: such pestiferous reports of men very nobly held

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: can serve the world for no honest use. Therefore

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: you must die.—Come, headsman, off with his

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: head.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: O Lord, sir, let me live, or let me see my

speaker: PAROLLES
text: death!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: That shall you, and take your leave of

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text:
all your friends.
                 
                He
                 
                removes
                 
                the
                 
                blindfold
                .
               So,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: look about you. Know you any here?

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Good morrow, noble captain.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: God bless you, Captain Parolles.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: God save you, noble captain.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Captain, what greeting will you to my

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Lord Lafew? I am for France.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Good captain, will you give me a copy of

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: the sonnet you writ to Diana in behalf of the Count

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Rossillion? An I were not a very coward, I’d compel

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: it of you. But fare you well.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: You are undone, captain—all but your

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: scarf; that has a knot on ’t yet.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Who cannot be crushed with a plot?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: If you could find out a country where

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: but women were that had received so much

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: shame, you might begin an impudent nation. Fare

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: you well, sir. I am for France too. We shall speak of

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: you there.

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
Yet
               
              am
               
              I
               
              thankful
              .
               
              If
               
              my
               
              heart
               
              were
               
              great
              ,

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
’Twould
               
              burst
               
              at
               
              this
              .
               
              Captain
               
              I’ll
               
              be
               
              no
               
              more
              ,

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
But
               
              I
               
              will
               
              eat
               
              and
               
              drink
              ,
               
              and
               
              sleep
               
              as
               
              soft

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
As
               
              captain
               
              shall
              .
               
              Simply
               
              the
               
              thing
               
              I
               
              am

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
Shall
               
              make
               
              me
               
              live
              .
               
              Who
               
              knows
               
              himself
               
              a
               
              braggart
              ,

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
Let
               
              him
               
              fear
               
              this
              ,
               
              for
               
              it
               
              will
               
              come
               
              to
               
              pass

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
That
               
              every
               
              braggart
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              found
               
              an
               
              ass
              .

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
Rust
              ,
               
              sword
              ;
               
              cool
              ,
               
              blushes
              ;
               
              and
               
              Parolles
               
              live

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
Safest
               
              in
               
              shame
              .
               
              Being
               
              fooled
              ,
               
              by
               
              fool’ry
               
              thrive
              .

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
There’s
               
              place
               
              and
               
              means
               
              for
               
              every
               
              man
               
              alive
              .

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
I’ll
               
              after
               
              them
              .
